newsitem.title: USA: Eagle Point cites continuing softness.
newsitem.headline: Eagle Point cites continuing softness.

text.p: Eagle Point Software Corp said its weaker December 31 second-quarter results reflect continuing softness in the AutoCAD and AutoCAD-related markets as well as delays in customer software purchases.

Chief executive officer Rod Blum in a statement also said, "We've noticed that portions of some of our markets have slowed their purchasing decisions as they assimilate the effects of the proposed merger between Autodesk Inc and Softdesk Inc."

Eagle Point, a supplier of architecture, engineering and construction software, earlier Monday reported a quarterly loss of $0.05 a share, which included a nonrecurring charge. Ecluding the charge, the loss was $0.01 a share. Revenues declined to $4.1 million from $5 million.
